title: Model Item Setup
content:

Model Item Setup

 

  • Model Item Setup
    • Filters
    • Creating a Model Item
    • Editing a Model Item
    • Deleting a Model Item
      • Field Description
      • Action Buttons

Model Item Setup assists you in benchmarking a new item with an existing one. It checks the history of an existing item that would be similar to the new model, which further helps in planning or allocating inventory. Item modeling is applicable to all locations or location categories for an item.

Currently, the model item is configured for both style and style-color levels. If modeling is configured on both levels, the style-color modeling will be honored.

Users can configure the modeling from the UI and interface. When configuring the modeling from the UI, users will need to type in target and model style/style-colors.  

The model metric will be computed at the size level. The metric values will not be copied over if the model and target items have different colors and sizes.

 

 

Filters

Target Item ID

 

Creating a Model Item

 

To create a new model item:

 

  1. Select Menu > Configurations > Item> Model Item Setup
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Click Create to view the Model Item Setup window.
  4. Enter the Target Item Id, Style Property, and choose Yes or No for Continues Metric Copy. You can also click on the search icon for Target Item Id to open the Item Lookup wherein you can search for a item using criteria such as -Item ID, Department, Material, Name, Class, Subclass, Style Template, Brand, Color, Vendor, Size, or ItemType. Choose the desired item and click Save and Continue.
  5. Select a Model item from the given list in the next screen, or click on Add New to add a new model item using the Model Item Id, Style Property, or any of the above search criteria for a item.
  6. Click Save and Finish.
Note: All mandatory fields are denoted with *.

Editing a Model Item

 

To edit a model item:

 

Swipe-out List

  1. Select Menu > Configurations > Item > Model Item Setup.
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Select the required item record. Swipe-out the menu on the required record card and select Edit.
  4. In the Model Item Setup window, modify the required fields.
  5. Click Save & Close to save the modified item details.

Edit View

  1. Select the required model item record.  The action buttons are displayed in the footer section.
  2. Click Edit to view the Item item Setup window, and modify the required fields.
  3. Click Save & Close to save the modified item details.

 

Deleting a Model Item

 

To delete a model item:

 

Swipe-out List

  1. Select Menu > Configurations > Item > Model ItemSetup.
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Swipe-out menu on the required record card and select Delete.
  4. A confirmation pop-up prompts as 'Deletion of Model Item Setup is irreversible'.
  5. Click Yes to delete the item.

Delete

  1. Select the required record card. The footer section with action buttons is displayed.
  2. Select Delete.
  3. A confirmation pop-up prompts as 'Deletion of Model Item Setup is irreversible'.
  4. Click Yes to delete the item.

 

Field Description

The following are the field descriptions of the attributes available on the screen.

 

Field

 

Description

 
Target Item Id An alphanumeric ID that uniquely defines each target store.
Model Item Count The number of model stores chosen for a specific target store.
Style Property Specifies the style property of the item.
Continuous Metric Property Defines whether the continuous metrics are available or not for the item.

 

Action Buttons

The following are the action buttons available on the screen.

 

Create Opens the Model Item Setup window. 
Deselect Clears the selected records.
Edit Opens the Model Item Setup window displaying details of the selected record.
Delete Deletes the selected record.

As per the method configuration,
allocation will look for model metric values from 2020-01-06 to 2020-01-27.

As we are not having any model metric values in these dates, the need will be 0 and supply will not get allocated.

"2020-01-13": "130",
"2020-01-20": "139",
"2020-01-27": "161"		   currentbuisness date , -04 , 04 2020-01-12 + 0 weeks = 2020-01-12

In this scenario, Allocation will use the model metric before activation date (2020-1-12) and after activation date (2020-1-12) metric(sales) values will be used.

As per the method configurationallocation system will look for model/metric  values from 2020-01-06 to 2020-01-27.

As we are not having any model metric value for 2020-01-06 week.Need for this week will be 0.Total need will be : 0 + 130+139+161  =430.

Supply will get allocated for this need.
2a. Use metric (sales) data after activation date and model metric values before activation date. 0 2020-01-12 2020-02-03 "2020-01-13": "130",
"2020-01-20": "139",
"2020-01-27": "161"		 "2019-12-30": "102", "2020-01-06": "114" currentbusinessdate, -04, 04 2020-01-12 + 0 weeks = 2020-01-12

In this scenario, Allocation will use the model metric until 2020-1-12 and use metric(sales) values thereafter.

As per the method configuration,
allocation system will look for model metric values from 2020-01-06 to 2020-01-27.

As we are having model metric value for 2020-01-06 week.Need for this week will be 114.

Total need will be : 114 + 130+139+161 =544.

Supply will get allocated for this need.
